availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Marshall County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Sarah C. Truitt Blewett on November 15, 1853. Father of William D. Blewett, Amanda Blewett, Lucy M. Blewett, Mary M. Blewett, and Ida Blewett. Farmer in Marshall County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Marshall County, p. 168.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Marshall County, p. 6.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Marshall County, Staton District, p. 34.
Marriage Records: Kentucky Marriages, (Richmond, KY: Madison County Courthouse), film no. 000242961, p. 43..
Find A Grave, "Thomas Hill Blewett (1824-1887)," Memorial #31141206, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/31141206 (accessed August 20, 2018).
